text: we are in the warehouse where we store
the replacement coats when Thomas Weston
came to live and work in Cocoa D it was
supposed to be his last move we have a
stock of electrical items and if any of
them goes faulty we replace them on
behalf of the retailer he and his wife
relocated from Ireland when we love this
country we wanted to be here we bought a
house here to settle and to go out but
the EU referendums changed everything
the decision to leave Europe was a
decision that meant for us we have to
leave I will sell the house and use the
assets to reinvent ourselves and how do
you feel about that we had a future here
we had dream I need a new dream Thomas
is married to artist Elka who like him
no longer feels welcome in the UK I
can't really see myself living in the
country where I have to apply for a
working permit and a visa every time I
want to come here and to live in my own
house they've decided not to wait to see
if post breaks it Britain makes them a
better offer what will you miss most
about living here my friends my friends
and what do they say to you and you tell
them you've decided to go stay sorry we
have to stop you
the Westons are among a hundred and
seventy three thousand EU nationals
living here in Scotland the First
Minister Nicola Sturgeon is trying to
persuade as many as possible to remain
but the westerns have made up their
minds to pack up and leave these shores
to find a new home in a country that's
definitely remaining part of the EU Glen
Campbell reporting Scotland Kirkcaldy
